verses.verse: ( Waters from under the Temple) וַיְשִׁבֵנִי֮ <WH7725> way·ši·ḇê·nî Then [the man] brought me back אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to פֶּ֣תַח <WH6607> pe·ṯaḥ the entrance הַבַּיִת֒ <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ of the temple, וְהִנֵּה־ <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh- and I saw מַ֣יִם <WH4325> ma·yim water יֹצְאִ֗ים <WH3318> yō·ṣə·’îm flowing מִתַּ֨חַת <WH8478> mit·ta·ḥaṯ from under מִפְתַּ֤ן <WH4670> mip̄·tan the threshold הַבַּ֙יִת֙ <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ of the temple קָדִ֔ימָה <WH6921> qā·ḏî·māh toward the east כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- ( for פְנֵ֥י <WH6440> p̄ə·nê faced הַבַּ֖יִת <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ the temple קָדִ֑ים <WH6921> qā·ḏîm east ). וְהַמַּ֣יִם <WH4325> wə·ham·ma·yim The water יֹרְדִ֗ים <WH3381> yō·rə·ḏîm was coming down מִתַּ֜חַת <WH8478> mit·ta·ḥaṯ from under מִכֶּ֤תֶף <WH3802> mik·ke·ṯep̄ side הַבַּ֙יִת֙ <WH1004> hab·ba·yiṯ of the temple, הַיְמָנִ֔ית <WH3233> hay·mā·nîṯ the south מִנֶּ֖גֶב <WH5045> min·ne·ḡeḇ south לַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃ <WH4196> lam·miz·bê·aḥ of the altar.

וַיּוֹצִאֵנִי֮ <WH3318> way·yō·w·ṣi·’ê·nî Next he brought me out דֶּֽרֶךְ־ <WH1870> de·reḵ- through שַׁ֣עַר <WH8179> ša·‘ar gate צָפוֹנָה֒ <WH6828> ṣā·p̄ō·w·nāh the north וַיְסִבֵּ֙נִי֙ <WH5437> way·sib·bê·nî and led me around דֶּ֣רֶךְ <WH1870> de·reḵ ... ח֔וּץ <WH2351> ḥūṣ the outside אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to שַׁ֣עַר <WH8179> ša·‘ar gate הַח֔וּץ <WH2351> ha·ḥūṣ the outer דֶּ֖רֶךְ <WH1870> de·reḵ ... הַפּוֹנֶ֣ה <WH6437> hap·pō·w·neh facing קָדִ֑ים <WH6921> qā·ḏîm east, וְהִנֵּה־ <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh- and there I saw מַ֣יִם <WH4325> ma·yim the water מְפַכִּ֔ים <WH6379> mə·p̄ak·kîm trickling out מִן־ <WH4480> min- from הַכָּתֵ֖ף <WH3802> hak·kā·ṯêp̄ side. הַיְמָנִֽית׃ <WH3233> hay·mā·nîṯ the south

בְּצֵאת־ <WH3318> bə·ṣêṯ- went הָאִ֥ישׁ <WH376> hā·’îš As the man קָדִ֖ים <WH6921> qā·ḏîm eastward וְקָ֣ו <WH6957> wə·qāw with a measuring line בְּיָד֑וֹ <WH3027> bə·yā·ḏōw in his hand, וַיָּ֤מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ he measured off אֶ֙לֶף֙ <WH505> ’e·lep̄ a thousand בָּֽאַמָּ֔ה <WH520> bā·’am·māh cubits ( 1000 (long) cubits is approximately 1750 feet or 533.4 meters.) וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֥נִי <WH5674> way·ya·‘ă·ḇi·rê·nî and led me through בַמַּ֖יִם <WH4325> ḇam·ma·yim water. מֵ֥י <WH4325> mê - אָפְסָֽיִם׃ <WH657> ’ā·p̄ə·sā·yim ankle-deep

וַיָּ֣מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ Then he measured off אֶ֔לֶף <WH505> ’e·lep̄ a thousand [cubits] וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֥נִי <WH5674> way·ya·‘ă·ḇi·rê·nî and led me through בַמַּ֖יִם <WH4325> ḇam·ma·yim water מַ֣יִם <WH4325> ma·yim vvv. בִּרְכָּ֑יִם <WH1290> bir·kā·yim knee-deep וַיָּ֣מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ Again he measured אֶ֔לֶף <WH505> ’e·lep̄ a thousand [cubits] וַיַּעֲבִרֵ֖נִי <WH5674> way·ya·‘ă·ḇi·rê·nî and led me through מֵ֥י <WH4325> mê water. מָתְנָֽיִם׃ <WH4975> mā·ṯə·nā·yim waist-deep

וַיָּ֣מָד <WH4058> way·yā·māḏ Once again he measured off אֶ֔לֶף <WH505> ’e·lep̄ a thousand [cubits], נַ֕חַל <WH5158> na·ḥal but now it was a river אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- not אוּכַ֖ל <WH3201> ’ū·ḵal I could לַעֲבֹ֑ר <WH5674> la·‘ă·ḇōr cross, כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- because גָא֤וּ <WH1342> ḡā·’ū had risen הַמַּ֙יִם֙ <WH4325> ham·ma·yim the water מֵ֣י <WH4325> mê [and] שָׂ֔חוּ <WH7813> śā·ḥū was deep enough for swimming — נַ֖חַל <WH5158> na·ḥal a river אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer that לֹֽא־ <WH3808> lō- could not יֵעָבֵֽר׃ <WH5674> yê·‘ā·ḇêr be crossed on foot.

וַיֹּ֥אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer he asked אֵלַ֖י <WH413> ’ê·lay .... הֲרָאִ֣יתָ <WH7200> hă·rā·’î·ṯā do you see this? ” בֶן־ <WH1121> ḇen- “ Son אָדָ֑ם <WH120> ’ā·ḏām of man, וַיּוֹלִכֵ֥נִי <WH1980> way·yō·w·li·ḵê·nî Then he led me וַיְשִׁבֵ֖נִי <WH7725> way·ši·ḇê·nî back שְׂפַ֥ת <WH8193> śə·p̄aṯ to the bank הַנָּֽחַל׃ <WH5158> han·nā·ḥal of the river.

בְּשׁוּבֵ֕נִי <WH7725> bə·šū·ḇê·nî When I arrived, וְהִנֵּה֙ <WH2009> wə·hin·nêh I saw אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- ... שְׂפַ֣ת <WH8193> śə·p̄aṯ banks הַנַּ֔חַל <WH5158> han·na·ḥal of the river. עֵ֖ץ <WH6086> ‘êṣ trees רַ֣ב <WH7227> raḇ number of מְאֹ֑ד <WH3966> mə·’ōḏ a great מִזֶּ֖ה <WH2088> miz·zeh along both וּמִזֶּֽה׃ <WH2088> ū·miz·zeh ...

וַיֹּ֣אמֶר <WH559> way·yō·mer And he said אֵלַ֗י <WH413> ’ê·lay to me, הַמַּ֤יִם <WH4325> ham·ma·yim water הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ <WH428> hā·’êl·leh “ This יוֹצְאִ֗ים <WH3318> yō·wṣ·’îm flows out אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to הַגְּלִילָה֙ <WH1552> hag·gə·lî·lāh region הַקַּדְמוֹנָ֔ה <WH6930> haq·qaḏ·mō·w·nāh the eastern וְיָרְד֖וּ <WH3381> wə·yā·rə·ḏū and goes down עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- into הָֽעֲרָבָ֑ה <WH6160> hā·‘ă·rā·ḇāh the Arabah. וּבָ֣אוּ <WH935> ū·ḇā·’ū When it empties הַיָּ֔מָּה <WH3220> hay·yām·māh the Sea, ( That is, the Dead Sea) אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- into הַיָּ֥מָּה <WH3220> hay·yām·māh vvv הַמּֽוּצָאִ֖ים <WH3318> ham·mū·ṣā·’îm ... וְנִרְפְּאוּ <WH7495> wə·nir·pə·ʾū becomes fresh. ( Hebrew is healed; also in verses 9 and 11) הַמָּֽיִם׃ <WH4325> ham·mā·yim the water there

וְהָיָ֣ה <WH1961> wə·hā·yāh there will be כָל־ <WH3605> ḵāl vvv נֶ֣פֶשׁ <WH5315> ne·p̄eš of living חַיָּ֣ה׀ <WH2416> ḥay·yāh creatures אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ăšer- vvv יִשְׁרֹ֡ץ <WH8317> yiš·rōṣ swarms אֶ֣ל <WH413> ’el Wherever כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- ... אֲשֶׁר֩ <WH834> ’ă·šer - יָב֨וֹא <WH935> yā·ḇō·w flows, שָׁ֤ם <WH8033> šām - נַחֲלַ֙יִם֙ <WH5158> na·ḥă·la·yim the river יִֽחְיֶ֔ה <WH2421> yiḥ·yeh - וְהָיָ֥ה <WH1961> wə·hā·yāh [and] הַדָּגָ֖ה <WH1710> had·dā·ḡāh fish, רַבָּ֣ה <WH7227> rab·bāh a great number of מְאֹ֑ד <WH3966> mə·’ōḏ ... כִּי֩ <WH3588> kî because בָ֨אוּ <WH935> ḇā·’ū flows שָׁ֜מָּה <WH8033> šām·māh there הַמַּ֣יִם <WH4325> ham·ma·yim [it] הָאֵ֗לֶּה <WH428> hā·’êl·leh - וְיֵרָֽפְאוּ֙ <WH7495> wə·yê·rā·p̄ə·’ū and makes the waters fresh; וָחָ֔י <WH2421> wā·ḥāy will flourish. כֹּ֛ל <WH3605> kōl everything אֲשֶׁר־ <WH834> ’ă·šer- so wherever יָ֥בוֹא <WH935> yā·ḇō·w flows, שָׁ֖מָּה <WH8033> šām·māh - הַנָּֽחַל׃ <WH5158> han·nā·ḥal the river

וְהָיָה֩ <WH1961> wə·hā·yāh יַעַמְדוּ <WH5975> ya·ʿam·ḏū will stand עָלָ֜יו <WH5921> ‘ā·lāw by the shore; דַּוָּגִ֗ים <WH1728> daw·wā·ḡîm Fishermen מֵעֵ֥ין <WH5872> mê·‘ên גֶּ֙דִי֙ <WH5872> ge·ḏî from En-gedi וְעַד־ <WH5704> wə·‘aḏ- to עֵ֣ין <WH5882> ‘ên vvv עֶגְלַ֔יִם <WH5882> ‘eḡ·la·yim En-eglaim מִשְׁט֥וֹחַ <WH4894> miš·ṭō·w·aḥ spread לַֽחֲרָמִ֖ים <WH2764> la·ḥă·rā·mîm their nets יִהְי֑וּ <WH1961> yih·yū they will לְמִינָה֙ <WH4327> lə·mî·nāh kinds, תִּהְיֶ֣ה <WH1961> tih·yeh ... דְגָתָ֔ם <WH1710> ḏə·ḡā·ṯām [to catch] fish כִּדְגַ֛ת <WH1710> kiḏ·ḡaṯ like the fish הַיָּ֥ם <WH3220> hay·yām Sea. ( That is, the Mediterranean Sea; also in verses 15, 19, and 20) הַגָּד֖וֹל <WH1419> hag·gā·ḏō·wl of the Great רַבָּ֥ה <WH7227> rab·bāh of many מְאֹֽד׃ <WH3966> mə·’ōḏ ...

בִּצֹּאתוֹ <WH1207> biṣ·ṣō·ṯō But the swamps וּגְבָאָ֛יו <WH1360> ū·ḡə·ḇā·’āw and marshes וְלֹ֥א <WH3808> wə·lō will not יֵרָפְא֖וּ <WH7495> yê·rā·p̄ə·’ū become fresh; לְמֶ֥לַח <WH4417> lə·me·laḥ for salt. נִתָּֽנוּ׃ <WH5414> nit·tā·nū they will be left

וְעַל־ <WH5921> wə·‘al- Along הַנַּ֣חַל <WH5158> han·na·ḥal of the river, יַעֲלֶ֣ה <WH5927> ya·‘ă·leh will grow. עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- ... שְׂפָת֣וֹ <WH8193> śə·p̄ā·ṯōw banks מִזֶּ֣ה׀ <WH2088> miz·zeh both וּמִזֶּ֣ה׀ <WH2088> ū·miz·zeh ... כָּל־ <WH3605> kāl- of all kinds עֵֽץ־ <WH6086> ‘êṣ- trees מַ֠אֲכָל <WH3978> ma·’ă·ḵāl fruit לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- will not יִבּ֨וֹל <WH5034> yib·bō·wl wither, עָלֵ֜הוּ <WH5929> ‘ā·lê·hū Their leaves וְלֹֽא־ <WH3808> wə·lō- will not יִתֹּ֣ם <WH8552> yit·tōm fail. פִּרְי֗וֹ <WH6529> pir·yōw and their fruit לָֽחֳדָשָׁיו֙ <WH2320> lā·ḥo·ḏā·šāw Each month יְבַכֵּ֔ר <WH1069> yə·ḇak·kêr they will bear fruit, כִּ֣י <WH3588> kî because מֵימָ֔יו <WH4325> mê·māw the water מִן־ <WH4480> min- from הַמִּקְדָּ֖שׁ <WH4720> ham·miq·dāš the sanctuary הֵ֣מָּה <WH1992> hêm·māh ... יֽוֹצְאִ֑ים <WH3318> yō·wṣ·’îm flows to them. וְהָיוּ <WH1961> wə·hå̄·yū will be used פִרְיוֹ֙ <WH6529> p̄ir·yōw Their fruit לְמַֽאֲכָ֔ל <WH3978> lə·ma·’ă·ḵāl for food וְעָלֵ֖הוּ <WH5929> wə·‘ā·lê·hū and their leaves לִתְרוּפָֽה׃ס <WH8644> liṯ·rū·p̄āh for healing. ”

( The Borders of the Land) כֹּ֤ה <WH3541> kōh This is what אָמַר֙ <WH559> ’ā·mar says: אֲדֹנָ֣י <WH136> ’ă·ḏō·nāy the Lord יְהוִ֔ה <WH3069> Yah·weh GOD גֵּ֤ה <WH1454> gêh “ These [are] גְבוּל֙ <WH1366> ḡə·ḇūl the boundaries אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer by which תִּתְנַחֲל֣וּ <WH5157> tiṯ·na·ḥă·lū as an inheritance אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - הָאָ֔רֶץ <WH776> hā·’ā·reṣ you are to divide the land לִשְׁנֵ֥י <WH8147> liš·nê among the twelve עָשָׂ֖ר <WH6240> ‘ā·śār ... שִׁבְטֵ֣י <WH7626> šiḇ·ṭê tribes יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel; יוֹסֵ֖ף <WH3130> yō·w·sêp̄ Joseph חֲבָלִֽים׃ <WH2256> ḥă·ḇā·lîm shall receive two portions. ( Since Levi had no portion, Joseph’s sons Ephraim and Manasseh received land as two tribes.)

וּנְחַלְתֶּ֤ם <WH5157> ū·nə·ḥal·tem You are to divide אוֹתָהּ֙ <WH853> ’ō·w·ṯāh it אִ֣ישׁ <WH376> ’îš equally כְּאָחִ֔יו <WH251> kə·’ā·ḥîw among them. אֲשֶׁ֤ר <WH834> ’ă·šer Because נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ <WH5375> nā·śā·ṯî I swore with an uplifted אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - יָדִ֔י <WH3027> yā·ḏî hand לְתִתָּ֖הּ <WH5414> lə·ṯit·tāh to give לַאֲבֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם <WH1> la·’ă·ḇō·ṯê·ḵem it to your forefathers, וְנָ֨פְלָ֜ה <WH5307> wə·nā·p̄ə·lāh will fall הָאָ֧רֶץ <WH776> hā·’ā·reṣ land הַזֹּ֛את <WH2063> haz·zōṯ this לָכֶ֖ם Prep│2mp ( lā·ḵem) to you בְּנַחֲלָֽה׃ 5159 Prep-b│N-fs ( bə·na·ḥă·lāh) as an inheritance.
